job_generator.py

1 '''!
2 @brief This file contains the code for the job generator.
3 '''
4 import random
5 import copy
6 import networkx as nx
7 import numpy as np
8 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
9 import sys
10 import simpy
11 
12 import common
13 import DASH_Sim_utils
14 import CP_models
15 
16 class JobGenerator:
17  '''!
18  Define the JobGenerator class to handle dynamic job generation
19  '''
20  def __init__(self, env, resource_matrix, jobs, scheduler, PE_list):
21  '''!
22  @param env: Pointer to the current simulation environment
23  @param resource_matrix: The data structure that defines power/performance characteristics of the PEs for each supported task
24  @param jobs: The list of all jobs given to DASH-Sim
25  @param scheduler: Pointer to the DASH_scheduler
26  @param PE_list: The PEs available in the current SoCs
27  '''
28  self.env = env
29  self.resource_matrix = resource_matrix
30  self.jobs = jobs
31  self.scheduler = scheduler
32  self.PEs = PE_list
33 
34 
35  # Initially none of the tasks are outstanding
36  common.TaskQueues.outstanding = common.TaskManager() # List of *all* tasks waiting to be processed
37 
38  # Initially none of the tasks are completed
39  common.TaskQueues.completed = common.TaskManager() # List of completed tasks
40 
41  # Initially none of the tasks are running on the PEs
42  common.TaskQueues.running = common.TaskManager() # List of currently running tasks
43 
44  # Initially none of the tasks are completed
45  common.TaskQueues.ready = common.TaskManager() # List of tasks that are ready for processing
46 
47  # Initially none of the tasks are in wait ready queue
48  common.TaskQueues.wait_ready = common.TaskManager() # List of tasks that are waiting for being ready for processing
49 
50  # Initially none of the tasks are executable
51  common.TaskQueues.executable = common.TaskManager() # List of tasks that are ready for execution
52 
53  self.generate_job = True # Initially $generate_job is True so that as soon as run function is called
54  # it will start generating jobs
55  self.max_num_jobs = common.max_num_jobs # Number of jobs to be created
56  self.generated_job_list = [] # List of all jobs that are generated
57  self.offset = 0 # This value will be used to assign correct ID numbers for incoming tasks
58 
59  self.action = env.process(self.run()) # Starts the run() method as a SimPy process
60 
61  def run(self):
62  '''
63  Inject new jobs in the system based on the defined injection rate (scale value in config_file.ini) and total number of jobs to be injected (inject_fixed_num_jobs and max_jobs in config_file.ini).
64  '''
65  i = 0 # Initialize the iteration variable
66  num_jobs = 0
67  count = 0
68  summation = 0
69  np.random.seed(common.iteration)
70 
71 
72  if len(DASH_Sim_utils.get_current_job_list()) != len(self.jobs.list) and DASH_Sim_utils.get_current_job_list() != []:
73  print('[E] Time %s: Job_list and job_file configs have different lengths, please check SoC.**.txt file'
74  % (self.env.now))
75  sys.exit()
76 
77  while (self.generate_job): # Continue generating jobs till #generate_job is False
78 
79  if (common.results.job_counter >= common.max_jobs_in_parallel or (common.job_list != [] and common.snippet_ID_inj == common.snippet_ID_exec)):
80  try:
81  yield self.env.timeout(common.simulation_clk)
82  except simpy.exceptions.Interrupt:
83  pass
84  else:
85  valid_jobs = []
86  common.current_job_list = DASH_Sim_utils.get_current_job_list()
87  for index, job_counter in enumerate(common.job_counter_list):
88  if job_counter < common.current_job_list[index]:
89  valid_jobs.append(index)
90 
91  if valid_jobs != []:
92  selection = np.random.choice(valid_jobs)
93  #print('selected job id is',selection)
94  else:
95  num_of_apps = len(self.jobs.list)
96  selection = np.random.choice(list(range(num_of_apps)), 1, p=common.job_probabilities)
97  # print('selected job id is',selection)
98 
99  self.generated_job_list.append(copy.deepcopy(self.jobs.list[int(selection)])) # Create each job as a deep copy of the job chosen from job list
100  common.results.job_counter += 1
101  summation += common.results.job_counter
102  count += 1
103  common.results.average_job_number = summation/count
104 
105  if (common.DEBUG_JOB):
106  print('[D] Time %d: Job generator added job %d' % (self.env.now, i + 1))
107 
108  if (common.simulation_mode == 'validation'):
109  common.Validation.generated_jobs.append(i)
110 
111  for ii in range(len(self.generated_job_list[i].task_list)): # Go over each task in the job
112  next_task = self.generated_job_list[i].task_list[ii]
113  next_task.jobID = i # assign job id to the next task
114  next_task.base_ID = ii # also record the original ID of the next task
115  next_task.ID = ii + self.offset # and change the ID of the task accordingly
116 
117  if next_task.head:
118  next_task.job_start = self.env.now # When a new job is generated, its execution is also started
119  self.generated_job_list[i].head_ID = next_task.ID
120 
121  next_task.head_ID = self.generated_job_list[i].head_ID
122 
123  for k in range(len(next_task.predecessors)):
124  next_task.predecessors[k] += self.offset # also change the predecessors of the newly added task, accordingly
125 
126  if len(next_task.predecessors) > 0:
127  common.TaskQueues.outstanding.list.append(next_task) # Add the task to the outstanding queue since it has predecessors
128  # Next, print debug messages
129  if (common.DEBUG_SIM):
130  print('[D] Time %d: Adding task %d to the outstanding queue,'
131  % (self.env.now, next_task.ID), end='')
132  print(' task %d has predecessors:'
133  % (next_task.ID), next_task.predecessors)
134  else:
135  common.TaskQueues.ready.list.append(next_task) # Add the task to the ready queue since it has no predecessors
136  if (common.DEBUG_SIM):
137  print('[D] Time %s: Task %s is pushed to the ready queue list'
138  % (self.env.now, next_task.ID), end='')
139  print(', the ready queue list has %s tasks'
140  % (len(common.TaskQueues.ready.list)))
141  self.offset += len(self.generated_job_list[i].task_list)
142  # end of for ii in range(len(self.generated_job_list[i].list))
143 
144  if 'CP' in self.scheduler.name:
145  while len(common.TaskQueues.executable.list) > 0:
146  task = common.TaskQueues.executable.list.pop(-1)
147  common.TaskQueues.ready.list.append(task)
148 
149  CP_models.CP(self.env.now, self.PEs, self.resource_matrix, self.jobs, self.generated_job_list)
150 
151  # Update the job ID
152  i += 1
153  if self.env.now >= common.warmup_period or common.simulation_mode == 'validation':
154  num_jobs += 1
155  if common.job_counter_list != []:
156  common.job_counter_list[selection] += 1
157  count_complete_jobs = 0
158  # Check if all jobs for the current snippet were injected
159  common.current_job_list = DASH_Sim_utils.get_current_job_list()
160  for index, job_counter in enumerate(common.job_counter_list):
161  if job_counter == common.current_job_list[index]:
162  count_complete_jobs += 1
163  if count_complete_jobs == len(common.job_counter_list) and num_jobs < common.max_num_jobs:
164  # Get the next snippet's job list
165  common.snippet_ID_inj += 1
166  np.random.seed(common.iteration)
167  common.job_counter_list = [0]*len(common.current_job_list)
168 
169  if (common.simulation_mode == 'validation' or common.inject_fixed_num_jobs):
170  if (num_jobs >= self.max_num_jobs): # check if max number of jobs, given in config file, are created
171  self.generate_job = False # if yes, no more jobs will be added to simulation
172 
173 
174  # print ('lambda value is: %.2f' %(1/common.scale))
175  if common.fixed_injection_rate:
176  self.wait_time = common.scale
177  else:
178  self.wait_time = int(random.expovariate(1 / common.scale)) # assign an exponentially distributed random variable to $wait_time
179  try:
180  yield self.env.timeout(self.wait_time) # new job addition will be after this wait time
181  #yield self.env.timeout(a_list[i%len(a_list)])
182  except simpy.exceptions.Interrupt:
183  pass
184  # end of while (self.generate_job):
